titleStmt.title: Anton Door
born Vienna, June 20, 1833; died Vienna, Nov 7, 1919

publicationStmt.publisher: Schenker Documents Online in association with the Centre for Computing in the Humanities

sourceDesc.p: No source: created in electronic format.

encodingDesc.p: Encoding according to the CCH TEI Guidelines

div.p: Austrian pianist, teacher, and editor, pupil of Czerny and Simon Sechter. Door made international concert tours, and was professor of the advanced piano class at the Vienna Conservatory 1869-1901. He was a member of the Brahms Circle.

Door was one of the editorial team that Universal Edition assembled at its inception in 1901, among which Schenker was numbered; Door edited works by Beethoven. He was joint founder with Julius Epstein in 1879 of the Wiener Tonk√ºnstler-Verein.
